hanzi-su-wiki:
鉢

Значения

Горшок, миска

Мнемоника

Чаша, горшок — основные 本 предметы из металла 金 для дома.

Варианты

钵, 缽

缽缽RS
钵钵		鉢earthenware basin, alms bowl
  • basic 本 bowl 缶
  • modf. 缽 → 鉢
heisig_constituent: bowl, metal, gold, origin, book, tree, wood, one
heisig_story: Let bowl suggest a large and heavy golden bowl into which you are throwing all the books you own to mash them into pulp, for some outrageous reason you will have to think up yourself.
myStory:
место где хранятся книги

НЕ книга спрессованная под металлом
koohiiStory1: This is the BOWL of an alchemist: see how he mixes metals in his bowl, as he follows the instructions from his book?
koohiiStory2: If I was begging with a BOWL, I would want GOLD and BOOKS.
jp_readingExamples: 鉢 (はち), 植木鉢 (うえきばち)
WaniKani_Meaning_Mnemonic: Cast a book in gold to make a bowl. Books can be bent into the shape of a bowl, so then all you have to do is pour gold over it to keep it in that shape and ta-da! A bowl has been born!
WaniKani_Meaning_Info: Imagine creating this bowl yourself. Try not to burn your fingers with that hot gold.
WaniKani_Reading_Mnemonic: The gold bowl has a hatch (はち) attached to it, which used to be the book's back cover. That's fine, you use the hatch as a lid for the bowl!
WaniKani_Reading_Info: Okay, so this may not be the best bowl. You usually don't need a hatch or this much gold coating. But that's how they used to do it in the old days, so that's good enough for you!
Kanshudo_mnemonic: the gold (金) from your book (本) buys you a bowl

鉢字的基本解释

鉢
bō
见“钵”。

鉢字的汉语字典释义

[①]［bō］
［《廣韻》北末切，入末，幫。］
亦作“盋1”。“钵1”的繁体字。亦作“缽1”。
(1)梵语钵多罗（pātra）的省称。意为“應器”。僧人食具。底平，口略小，形圆稍扁。用泥或铁等制成。
(2)盛器。形似盆而小，用来盛饭、菜、茶水等。
(3)指衣钵。前人传下来的思想、学术、技能等。

鉢字的康熙字典解释

【戌集上】【金字部】　鉢； 康熙笔画：13； 页码：页1302第06
【廣韻】【集韻】【韻會】?北末切，音潑。【玉篇】器也。【蘇軾·宸奎閣?】廬山僧懷璉，持律嚴甚。上常賜以龍腦鉢盂，璉對使者焚之，曰：吾法以瓦鐵食，此鉢非法。使者歸奏，上嘉歎。又【梵書】自釋迦相傳有衣鉢，世相付受。後魏天竺國王子號達磨，出家入南海，齎衣鉢航海。至梁詣武帝，隱嵩山少林寺，以其法傳慧可。　又凡物相傳，皆曰衣鉢。【古今名賢集】和凝第十三名及第，後知舉，取范質第十三名，質往謝。凝曰：公文合在中選屈就，此傳老夫衣鉢耳。未幾，凝入相。後質拜相，有登庸衣鉢亦相傳之句。又【蘇軾詩】傳家有衣鉢。【註】家學有素也。　又【廣韻】亦作盋。【前漢·東方朔傳註】盂若盋而大，俗謂盋盂。　又無花果名優曇鉢。【廣志】狀似枇杷，不花而實。　又叶音瞥。【蘇軾·?梅詩】君行適吳我適越，笑指西湖作衣鉢。

Bowl
Chinese dictionary definition of words
[①]［bō］
["Guangyun" cut at the north end, enter the end, help. ]
Also known as "盋1". Traditional characters for "bo 1". Also known as "Bowl 1".
(1) The provincial name of Pātra in Sanskrit. It means "single device". Food utensils for monks. The bottom is flat, the mouth is slightly smaller, and the shape is round and slightly flat. Made of mud or iron.
(2) Container. It looks like a basin and is small, used to hold rice, vegetables, tea, etc.
(3) Refers to the mantle. Thoughts, academics, skills, etc. handed down from predecessors.

bō
вм. 钵
Radicals: 金, 本  (gold, book)
Meaning Mnemonic
Cast a book in gold to make a bowl. Books can be bent into the shape of a bowl, so then all you have to do is pour gold over it to keep it in that shape and ta-da! A bowl has been born!
Imagine creating this bowl yourself. Try not to burn your fingers with that hot gold.
Reading Mnemonic
The gold bowl has a hatch (はち) attached to it, which used to be the book's back cover. That's fine, you use the hatch as a lid for the bowl!
Okay, so this may not be the best bowl. You usually don't need a hatch or this much gold coating. But that's how they used to do it in the old days, so that's good enough for you!
